comment: I'm from Brazil and my autistic son is fascinated by music, he sings this melody all over the place. Congratulations on your success üòÄ

I was late in discovering Mr. Swims, but now that I have I'm obsessed with his music, especially this song. IMO it's the best thing I've ever heard. The song coupled with his unbelievable voice touches places and emotions no song before ever has. And I'm 76 years old so I've heard a lot of great music in my time. Bravo, Mr. Sims. If this definitive piece of work doesn't bring you the stardom you certainly deserve, something is wrong with the ears of everyone in the world. Thank you for sharing your talent and voice with us all.
Who's here in June 2025? This song is still powerful and soulful. Thank you, Teddy ‚ù§

üî•‚ù§‚Äçüî•üî•This man has the entire 100% full package in every single song he sings! His nuance, control, vocals, lyrics... lord I just can't get enough.  The first time I heard Teddy was when he sang Lose Control on the voice as a guest performer. My fiance and I didn't know who he was... WE WERE FLOORED!!! Glued to the tv and hit replay ... TWICE!  Holy crap. Who would've thought that it would be the floodgate to all things Teddy Swims ever since? I've gotten almost everything he's done so far, and I just can't turn it off. Seriously... no joke. On repeat. Everything. I heard an interview at C24, and it was cool to hear who he wanted to perform with: Paul McCartney, Stevie Wonder and Adele! WHEN CAN WE MAKE THAT HAPPEN!?  The world needs Teddy's light.  Blessings from the great Pacific Northwest, Lakewood, Washington!  üíõüñ§üíõ    #TeddySwims

Teddy, I dont say this often. Your amazing. Your voice touchs souls and warms hearts. My dog loves you. No Joking here. My Dog Bear heard this song and as you started to sing he turned his head to the Tv and started watching  you as you sang. He Never Does This.  I could see a smile on his face and he curled up as close as he could to me and put his head on my shoulder and  gazed in my eyes. You touched his heart Teddy. It was the most amazing thing I have seen him do since my wife passed away 2 years ago.  My Bear is a 8yr old 135lb  Cane Corso and has always been a very emotional dog.  Every time I play this song he does the same thing. He loves this song and so do I. Thank you

It was a cold and chilly day. The streets were white it was snowing. I entered Best Buy and I knew I had arrived to my destination. Christmas was almost here so I went to buy a Christmas present. And approached checkout and as I was waiting on line to pay for the present something unexpectedly magical happened. This song was being played on the Best Buy speakers. The volume was low and would increase out of nowhere and it would go through the roof. It was being overplayed and I just had to see who was the legend playing this song. I laid my eyes across the store only to see the one and only legend playing it. He was tall like Alex, old like Frank and Indian like Daniel. I smiled inside my head and I was looking around to see if anyone heard this legend like I heard him. His talents were amazing that I started snapping my fingers and stomping my foot automatically to the beat. In my head I was like ‚ÄúTURN UP THE BEAT!!!‚Äù üê∂üéßI was still there waiting for my item to arrive when all of a sudden my spirit animal blessed my ears and nose. He had just tooted right in front of me no one else in sight had heard. I could smell what had had eaten a Taco Bell burrito with beans cheese and no sour cream made by jessica at 2:27 pm. To be continued‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

My feeling is not envy. I really like Teddy's voice, but it's like complimenting someone for being beautiful. Beauty, voices like his or Adele's, are gifts of nature, not skills. Here, there are some good notes when he goes into a higher/louder vocal . And while I'm not particularly against the nasal style, something needs work in the lower register. I think of Joe Cocker's "Don't let me be misunderstood," and his nasal delivery works, and is more shaped. BUT, with all the sh**y mediocre so-called music spreading around like fire, this song can still be called music, and definitely deserves recognition.
